Operation 'getMovies' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary 'Get the status of your movies' is vague about what 'status' means in context. Description lacks clarity about return format and use case. Added domain-specific terminology ('rendering job statuses'), clarified that it returns a list of movie objects, explained the relationship between project ID and movie retrieval, and provided context about monitoring rendering progress for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Get the status of your movies
data.current_description: Get the status any of your movies by passing your project ID in the project query parameter. You can get your project ID from the response of the POST request.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the rendering status of movies associated with a specific project. Requires the project ID as a query parameter, which can be obtained from the POST /movies response. Returns a list of movie objects with their current rendering status, progress, and completion details. Use this operation to monitor the progress of submitted rendering jobs.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get the status of your movies' is vague about what 'status' means in context. Description lacks clarity about return format and use case. Added domain-specific terminology ('rendering job statuses'), clarified that it returns a list of movie objects, explained the relationship between project ID and movie retrieval, and provided context about monitoring rendering progress for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'newMovie' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description is too minimal and lacks critical details about what the operation accepts (movie object structure), what it returns (project ID for tracking), and important side effects (asynchronous background processing). Added context about the movie object parameter, return value details, asynchronous nature of rendering, and how to use the returned project ID for status tracking.

data.current_description: Submit a new movie rendering job.
data.description_suggestion: Submits a new movie rendering job to the JSON2Video API. Accepts a movie object defining the scenes, elements, and rendering parameters. Returns a project ID and rendering job details that can be used to track the rendering status via GET /movies. The rendering job is queued asynchronously and will process in the background. Use the returned project ID to monitor progress or retrieve the final rendered video.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented.
